trans-unit.source: Using the Azure preview portal to manage your Azure resources
trans-unit.target: Using the Azure preview portal to manage your Azure resources

trans-unit.source: Group multiple resources as a logical group that becomes the lifecycle boundary for resources contained within it.
trans-unit.target: Group multiple resources as a logical group that becomes the lifecycle boundary for resources contained within it.

trans-unit.source: Using the Azure Preview Portal to manage your Azure resources
trans-unit.target: Using the Azure Preview Portal to manage your Azure resources

trans-unit.source: Introduction
trans-unit.target: Introduction

trans-unit.source: Historically, managing a resource (a user-managed entity such as a database server, database, or website) in Microsoft Azure required you to perform operations against one resource at a time.
trans-unit.target: Historically, managing a resource (a user-managed entity such as a database server, database, or website) in Microsoft Azure required you to perform operations against one resource at a time.

trans-unit.source: If you had a complex application made up of multiple resources, management of this application became a complex task.
trans-unit.target: If you had a complex application made up of multiple resources, management of this application became a complex task.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure preview portal you can create resource groups to manage all your resources in an application together.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure preview portal you can create resource groups to manage all your resources in an application together.

trans-unit.source: Resource group is a new concept in Azure that serves as the lifecycle boundary for every resource contained within it.
trans-unit.target: Resource group is a new concept in Azure that serves as the lifecycle boundary for every resource contained within it.

trans-unit.source: Resource groups enable you to manage all your resources in an application together.
trans-unit.target: Resource groups enable you to manage all your resources in an application together.

trans-unit.source: Resource groups are enabled by the new management functionality, Azure Resource Manager.
trans-unit.target: Resource groups are enabled by the new management functionality, Azure Resource Manager.

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager allows you to group multiple resources as a logical group which serves as the lifecycle boundary for every resource contained within it.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager allows you to group multiple resources as a logical group which serves as the lifecycle boundary for every resource contained within it.

trans-unit.source: Typically a group will contain resources related to a specific application.
trans-unit.target: Typically a group will contain resources related to a specific application.

trans-unit.source: For example, a group may contain a Website resource that hosts your public website, a SQL Database that stores relational data used by the site, and a Storage Account that stores non-relational assets.
trans-unit.target: For example, a group may contain a Website resource that hosts your public website, a SQL Database that stores relational data used by the site, and a Storage Account that stores non-relational assets.

trans-unit.source: Here is a concise overview of how to use Resource groups within the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: Here is a concise overview of how to use Resource groups within the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Creating resource groups
trans-unit.target: Creating resource groups

trans-unit.source: Whenever a resource is created in the portal, it is always created within a resource group.
trans-unit.target: Whenever a resource is created in the portal, it is always created within a resource group.

trans-unit.source: You can choose to create a new resource group or use an existing resource group in the create flow.
trans-unit.target: You can choose to create a new resource group or use an existing resource group in the create flow.

trans-unit.source: create resource group
trans-unit.target: create resource group

trans-unit.source: When you create an application that consists of a few resources working together (e.g. Website + Database) it is always created in its own resource group, so you can manage the lifecycle of all related assets using the resource group.
trans-unit.target: When you create an application that consists of a few resources working together (e.g. Website + Database) it is always created in its own resource group, so you can manage the lifecycle of all related assets using the resource group.

trans-unit.source: You can add or remove additional resources from the resource group as your application evolves.
trans-unit.target: You can add or remove additional resources from the resource group as your application evolves.

trans-unit.source: create resource group
trans-unit.target: create resource group

trans-unit.source: Browsing resource groups
trans-unit.target: Browsing resource groups

trans-unit.source: You can browse all resource groups by clicking the Jumpbar on the left side of your screen.
trans-unit.target: You can browse all resource groups by clicking the Jumpbar on the left side of your screen.

trans-unit.source: A resource group has a blade that gives you all the information on a particular resource group.
trans-unit.target: A resource group has a blade that gives you all the information on a particular resource group.

trans-unit.source: The Resource group blade will also give you a unified view of your billing and monitoring information for all the resources in the Resource group.
trans-unit.target: The Resource group blade will also give you a unified view of your billing and monitoring information for all the resources in the Resource group.

trans-unit.source: The summary section shows a visual resource map of all the resources in the resource group, it also shows resources in other resource groups that are linked to the resource group.
trans-unit.target: The summary section shows a visual resource map of all the resources in the resource group, it also shows resources in other resource groups that are linked to the resource group.

trans-unit.source: The resource map also shows the status of each resource.
trans-unit.target: The resource map also shows the status of each resource.

trans-unit.source: resource group summary
trans-unit.target: resource group summary

trans-unit.source: The resource map part can be customized to show in a larger size which will display all the resources that are contained within the resource group and resources in other resource groups that are linked.
trans-unit.target: The resource map part can be customized to show in a larger size which will display all the resources that are contained within the resource group and resources in other resource groups that are linked.

trans-unit.source: This part can be pinned to the Starboard, which will copy the part to the Startboard.
trans-unit.target: This part can be pinned to the Starboard, which will copy the part to the Startboard.

trans-unit.source: pin
trans-unit.target: pin

trans-unit.source: Clicking on the resource map launches the list view of all the resources on the resource map.
trans-unit.target: Clicking on the resource map launches the list view of all the resources on the resource map.

trans-unit.source: This view will list all the resources within a resource group or linked to it.
trans-unit.target: This view will list all the resources within a resource group or linked to it.

trans-unit.source: Clicking on these resources will launch their blades.
trans-unit.target: Clicking on these resources will launch their blades.

trans-unit.source: see resources
trans-unit.target: see resources

trans-unit.source: Adding resources to resource groups
trans-unit.target: Adding resources to resource groups

trans-unit.source: You can add resources to a resource group using the **Add** command on the resource group blade.
trans-unit.target: You can add resources to a resource group using the **Add** command on the resource group blade.

trans-unit.source: Following the steps in the flow will allow you to add other resources to the resource group.
trans-unit.target: Following the steps in the flow will allow you to add other resources to the resource group.

trans-unit.source: add resource
trans-unit.target: add resource

trans-unit.source: Note: It is not advisable to put team project in the same resource group as other Azure resources.
trans-unit.target: Note: It is not advisable to put team project in the same resource group as other Azure resources.

trans-unit.source: If you create a Team Project in a new account and group, then create a Website, the site group will default to the last group used (VSO group) and you will end up with runtime/developer resources in the same group.
trans-unit.target: If you create a Team Project in a new account and group, then create a Website, the site group will default to the last group used (VSO group) and you will end up with runtime/developer resources in the same group.

trans-unit.source: Deleting resource groups
trans-unit.target: Deleting resource groups

trans-unit.source: Since resource groups allow you to manage the lifecycle of all the contained resources, deleting a resource group will delete all the resources contained within it.
trans-unit.target: Since resource groups allow you to manage the lifecycle of all the contained resources, deleting a resource group will delete all the resources contained within it.

trans-unit.source: You can also delete individual resources within a resource group.
trans-unit.target: You can also delete individual resources within a resource group.

trans-unit.source: You want to exercise caution when you are deleting a resource group since there might be other resources linked to it.
trans-unit.target: You want to exercise caution when you are deleting a resource group since there might be other resources linked to it.

trans-unit.source: You can see the linked resources in the resource map and take the necessary steps to avoid any unintentional consequences when you delete resource groups.
trans-unit.target: You can see the linked resources in the resource map and take the necessary steps to avoid any unintentional consequences when you delete resource groups.

trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.target: Getting Started

trans-unit.target: For an introduction to using Azure PowerShell when deploying resources, see [Using Azure PowerShell with Azure Resource Manager](../powershell-azure-resource-manager.md).

trans-unit.source: For an introduction to using Azure CLI when deploying resources, see [Using the Azure CLI for Mac, Linux, and Windows with Azure Resource Management](../xplat-cli-azure-resource-manager.md).
trans-unit.target: For an introduction to using Azure CLI when deploying resources, see [Using the Azure CLI for Mac, Linux, and Windows with Azure Resource Management](../xplat-cli-azure-resource-manager.md).

trans-unit.source: To learn about logically organizing your resources, see [Using tags to organize your Azure resources](../resource-group-using-tags.md).
trans-unit.target: To learn about logically organizing your resources, see [Using tags to organize your Azure resources](../resource-group-using-tags.md).

trans-unit.target: test
